Description: Amerigas agreed to refund more than $500,000 to resolve allegations it overcharged customers for propane gas.

Blue Rhino (Ferrellgas) and AmeriGas agreed to pay $1 million and $0.8 million respectively in settlement of allegations by the District Attorneys of Alameda, Fresno, Monterey, San Joaquin, Santa Clara, Sonoma, and Ventura counties that they reduced the amount of propane sold in their barbeque propane cylinders while keeping the tanks locked in cages before purchase, stopping customers from noticing that the content had been reduced.
The Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission finalized a settlement with UGI Utilities Inc. that ended an informal investigation into a natural gas explosion that destroyed a Lancaster County home.
The Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission finalized a settlement with UGI Utilities Inc. that includes a $5,000 civil penalty after a natural gas explosion in Lancaster.
Gas explosion that resulted in 5 fatalities and damage to businesses and nearby residences.
3rd party contractor hit a line causing an explosion that resulted in significant property damage.
Gas leaks triggered review of leak reporting and classification practices

The settlement was reached as part of an investigation into a 2017 natural gas-fueled explosion that resulted in one fatal injury to an UGI employee, non-life-threatening injuries to three other individuals, and approximately $2.2 million in damage to the surrounding properties on the Springdale Farms residential development in Millersville, Lancaster County.
